text:
Hi!
Welcome to 'This is My Architecture.'

My name is Liz, and today
I am here with Bashira
from IHS Markit.

-Hey Bashira, how's it going?
-Doing great.

-Well thanks for joining us today.
-Happy to be here.

Can you tell me
a little bit about IHS Markit?

Yeah, IHS Markit offers information,
analytics, technology,

and expertise to our customers,
so they can be operationally efficient
and make well-informed decisions.

Excellent, and today
we are going to be talking

about a virtual software training, right?
-Yep.

So basically, we have
a product called Kingdom.
It's a PETRA technical application.

And it's a very--
It requires high-end configurations
with GPU support to make it run.

And what we're doing
is we're using AppStream
to deliver that software.

And, basically,
whenever it's time for class
students just click on a streaming URL.

And that's it.
It's ready to go.
So they can one-click, log in to AppStream

from pretty much any lightweight,
end user device?

Yep, actually
they don't even have to log in.

It's a streaming URL, so it's just
Kingdom on the browser right there.

So what does that architecture
look like, then?
Okay, so in order for Kingdom to run,

it has a license server,
and we're using an EC2 for that.
And for Kingdom projects,

the storage for that,
we are using a file system,

FSx for the file system,
and then RDS for the database.

And basically all of that together
makes Kingdom run.

So if an instructor is going to set up
one of these classes,
what does the instructor need to do?
Okay, so these three resources

is what gets created
for every single class, right?

And we wanted to give the instructors
a very easy way

to have those running quickly
without starting days in advance

and just, you know,
accruing cost when it's not needed.

So we've provided them
with CloudFormation templates

so that they can customize the images
the way they need to,
and also create the resources very quickly.

So you mentioned that there are
a few different kinds of classes.

What are in those
CloudFormation templates?
Okay, so we are using--

Well obviously, these resources
that we see, RDS and FSx
And, in addition to that,

you know, the images
need to be customized, right?

And we need to get that
as part of the CloudFormation template.
So we have introduced a custom resource.
And basically what this does
is it triggers a Lambda function.

And we want to be able to 'remote enter'
the AppStream's image builder

and make the customizations that we need,
wait for the image to be created,
and that can take about 20 to 45 minutes.
But with Lambda we can do that

for the 15-minute
execution time max, right?
Yes, 15 minutes.
And we're using Systems Manager.
So basically, Lambda uses Systems Manager
to run a command on the EC2 right here.

And that does all the magic:
it runs a script,
remotes into the AppStream image builder.

One of the customizations
that's really important

is we have to modify a session script
in the image builder.

Which will make sure that the FSx
that just got provisioned in CloudFormation

is mounted whenever
the customer logs onto AppStream

so that they can
have access to their project.

Once that's done, the EC2
will send a signal back to CloudFormation

and we have a wait condition
and handle over here.
So once one meets those requirements,

then AppStream is provisioned
using the image we just created.
So it sounds like that's a great way

to ensure a really
high quality user experience.

Are there any design considerations
that have been made
for this architecture?
Yeah, so like I mentioned,

when we're recommending configurations
to customers

when they're running Kingdom
on their desktops,

we ask for very sophisticated,
GPU-supported, CPUs, right?

But for classes, we don't need
to use that for every single workflow.
It's going to be really expensive.

So unless a customer
is doing 3D visualizations
on billions of data points,
we are sizing our fleet accordingly.

So the CloudFormation template
gives the instructors parameters
to customize those as well.

That's a great way to align
with cost optimization.

Andy other cost optimization moves
you guys have made?

Yeah, so that's like a very easy switch
we made with RDS.

Usually we have a full SQL server
that's running there,

but we realized that our projects
are very small for the training purposes.

So just switching from a full SQL server
to a SQL express engine

reduced our cost by like 80%.
-Wow.

Well thank you for walking me
through the architecture, Bashira.

It's been very interesting
to learn how IHS Markit

is enabling virtual,
instructor-led training

for the Kingdom
PETRA technical application.

Thank you for joining us
on 'This is My Architecture.'
I look forward to catching you next time.
